comment: Mrs.J seems nice in her videos, unfortunately she doesn't like when students ask questions. This becomes a problem when the instructions are contradictory and vague at best. I am sure she does not intend to come off this way, but the way she responds to emails is concerning. She doesn't create the quizzes, and doesn't know the answers either. Sad.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Awful teacher who is dragging the class longer than it is supposed to last just because we have to prove that we presented speeches live. Instructions for assignments are unclear, and she will take points off, even though it isn't your fault because she can't be clear in her instructions. If you don't have Instagram, get it, required for this class

Professor Johnson is super kind! However, she does not provide clear grading criteria for many of the assignments, making them difficult to complete. She also isn't the easiest grader, and will take points off without providing an explanation as to why they were removed. She is just now putting in a lot of the grades last minute so beware of that.

She was an extremely hard grader. And one of the hardest classes I took. She wasn't great at emailing back, and all the information was very vague. Yes she gives good PowerPoints but if you miss them you miss all the things you need.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Loved loved loved having her as my professor. Super sweet and funny and gives good feedback. Beware there is a LOT of writing for this class but she's very supportive and quizzes are easy and have no lockdown.

She seems like she means well, but the class is insanely hard and she does not provide much information or help. Expects you to know pretty much everything and isn't very understanding if you need help.
Class is easy. She is just not a good teacher. She replies your emails either in a rude manner or she answers your question with a question. take someone else i beg
She changed our syllabus midway through and all her rubrics and grading criteria, making a very confusing semester. She gives very very vague feedback, it's difficult to decipher.

Not an easy class! Make sure you manage your time well bc sometimes we only had 2 days to make and present a speech to the class. A lot of classes had "spotlight challenges" which were basically improv speeches. There's a couple of group projects where you give a speech together. I think this was her first semester though so the course might change

CJ was an okay professor, but I wouldn't recommend her. The class itself is very easy, but she sent several rude emails, took forever to grade, and was very unorganized. Expectations were unclear, and beware of weekly discussions that aren't listed on the syllabus!
